result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa K Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Milwaukee County Sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant to have no Contact with Co-Defendant Leonard Sharlow.
Defendant to have no Contact with US Bank Mequon, or Victim Angela Brendemihl.
Upon release from Copper Lake, defendant is to either obtain full time employment or be enrolled as a full time student until a degree is earned.  Conditions are to be negotiated with Defendants Agent.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alyssa K Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alyssa K Walker in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits Pre-Sentence Investigation report.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel advises the court as to the defendants circumstances.  Court renders judgment.
Copy emailed to DA and to Atty Alme Boaz
Sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Alyssa K Walker in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. State will be recommending at sentencing : Withheld sentence; 8 years probation with conditions: No contact with L.S., Restitution, Absolute Sobriety, Counseling, No contact with US Bank, Condition time to be determined by the Court.  Parties request PSI be done. Court so orders.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Further proceedings at 11-16-2015 01:45 pm

Defendant Alyssa K Walker in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel files Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form. Counsel examines defendant, accepts said waiver & binds matter over for trial. State files Information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Court accepts plea. Counsel requests defendant to appear by video as she is in Copper Lake. State does not object.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
